info.title: Deliverect Place Enrichment API
info.description:
## Batch Processing Guide

The `/place_enrichment/batches` endpoint allows you to submit multiple places in a single batch for attribute enrichment. 
The batch will be processed asynchronously, and you can track its status using the returned batch ID.


#### Typical workflow:
1. Prepare your batch payload with:
   - A unique batch name for identification
   - List of places with their IDs and input data
   - Optional attribute set specification
2. Submit the batch using the POST `/place_enrichment/batches` endpoint
3. Use the returned batch ID to:
   - Check batch status at GET `/place_enrichment/batches/{batch_id}`
   - Retrieve results at GET `/place_enrichment/jobs?batchId={batch_id}`


#### Submitting a Batch:

Use POST `/place_enrichment/batches` to submit a batch.

**Example Batch Payload:**
```json
{
    "batch_name": "NYC Restaurants March 2024",
    "attribute_set": "core", 
    "jobs": [
        {
            "place_id": "place_nyc_123",
            "inputs": {
                "name": "Joe's Pizza",
                "latitude": 40.7359,
                "longitude": -73.9911,
                "full_address": "7 Carmine St, New York, NY 10014",
                "street": "Carmine St",
                "city": "New York",
                "state": "NY",
                "postalCode": "10014",
                "house": "7",
                "country": "United States",
                "country_code": "US",
                "type": "restaurant",
                "website": "http://www.joespizzanyc.com",
                "phone": "+12122555803"
            }
        }
    ]
}
```
**Place Input Parameters:**
For more details on the place input parameters, see the ```UniversalPlace``` schema in the schemas section below.

**Attribute Sets:**

The `attribute_set` parameter in your request determines which attributes will be enriched. Available options:

| Value | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| core | Default. Includes essential business attributes like website, phone, social media profiles, and basic operating status. Best for general business information. |
| all | Comprehensive enrichment including all core attributes plus additional data like price tier, cuisine types, amenities, and detailed business analysis. Takes longer but provides the most complete data. |
| open_closed | Focused enrichment that only checks if the business is permanently closed. Fastest option when you only need operating status. |

#### Tracking Batch Status:

Use GET `/place_enrichment/batches/{batch_id}` to monitor the progress of your batch. The response includes:

```json
{
    "id": "batch_2024_03_15_123456",
    "batch_name": "NYC Restaurants March 2024",
    "status": "in_progress",
    "jobs": {
        "pending": ["place_id_2", "place_id_3"],
        "in_progress": ["place_id_1"],
        "completed": ["place_id_4", "place_id_5"],
        "failed": []
    },
    "created_at": "2024-03-15T10:30:00Z",
    "updated_at": "2024-03-15T10:35:00Z"
}
```

The status field will be one of:
- `pending`: Batch is queued but not yet started
- `in_progress`: Batch is currently being processed
- `completed`: All jobs in the batch are finished
- `failed`: Batch encountered critical errors

#### Retrieving Job Results:

Once jobs are completed, use GET `/place_enrichment/jobs?batchId={batch_id}` to get the enrichment results. The response includes:

```json
{
    "jobs": [
        {
            "place_id": "place_nyc_123",
            "status": "completed",
            "outputs": {
                "website": "https://www.joespizzanyc.com",
                "phone": "+12122555803",
                "social_profiles": {
                    "instagram": "joespizzanyc",
                    "facebook": "joespizzanyc"
                },
                "is_permanently_closed": False,
                "price_tier": "$$",
                "last_enriched": "2024-03-15T10:35:00Z"
            },
            "job_metadata": {
                "created_at": "2024-03-15T10:30:00Z",
                "completed_at": "2024-03-15T10:35:00Z",
                "processing_time_seconds": 300
            }
        }
    ],
    "total_count": 1,
    "completed_count": 1
}
```

Each job result includes:
- Original place ID for tracking
- Enrichment outputs based on the requested attribute set
- Job metadata including timing information
- Processing status and any error details if failed

**Attribute Statuses:**

Attributes like name, address, phone number, and website include an `attribute_status` field indicating the verification state:

| Status | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| NOT_RUN | The attribute was not processed |
| RUN_CONDITION_FAILED | The attribute was processed but failed the run condition |
| RUN | The attribute was processed |
| ERROR | The attribute processing failed |

Example response with attribute statuses:
```json
{
    "outputs": {
        "website": "https://www.joespizzanyc.com",
        "phone": "+12122555803"
    },
    "job_metadata": {
        "attribute_status": {
            "website": "RUN",
            "phone": "RUN",
            "address": "RUN",
            "name": "RUN"
        }
    }
}
```

post.description:
Submit a batch of places for enrichment processing

The batch_id field is optional. If not provided, a new UUID will be generated.
If an existing batch ID is provided, the new jobs will be added to that batch,
and any existing jobs with the same place_id will be updated.

**Prefilled Data Feature:**

You can include prefilled attribute data using the `prefilled_data` field in each job.
This allows you to insert known attribute values directly into the database without
requiring AI enrichment. This feature is only available when `kick_off_jobs_now` is False.

Supported prefilled attributes:
- `phoneNumbers`: Phone number information
- `websites`: Website URL and validation data  
- `closed_permanently`: Business closure status
- `openingHours`: Operating hours information
- `categories`: Business categories
- Custom attributes: Any custom attribute key

Example prefilled data formats:
```json
{
    "phoneNumbers": "+12122555803",  // Simple string format
    // OR complex format:
    "phoneNumbers": {
        "phone_number": "+12122555803",
        "additional_numbers": [
            {"phone_type": "whatsapp", "phone_number": "+12122555804"}
        ],
        "reasoning": "Found on official website",
        "confidence": "HIGH"
    },
    "websites": "https://example.com",  // Simple string format
    // OR complex format:
    "websites": {
        "url": "https://example.com",
        "has_website": true,
        "reasoning": "Official business website",
        "confidence": "NAP"
    },
    "closed_permanently": false,  // Simple boolean format
    // OR complex format:
    "closed_permanently": {
        "is_permanently_closed": false,
        "reasoning": "Business is currently operating",
        "confidence": "HIGH"
    }
}
```

400.description: Batch size exceeds maximum limit of 50,000 records or invalid input format

get.description:
Retrieve batches for an organization with pagination and optional search by name.

Returns a paginated list of batch jobs with their metadata including batch ID, 
creation timestamp, and job counts. If 'query' is provided, only batches whose name matches (case-insensitive, substring) will be returned.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Number of batches to return per page
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Number of batches to return per page

parameters.name: query

schema.description: Optional search string to filter batches by name (case-insensitive)
schema.title: Query

parameters.description: Optional search string to filter batches by name (case-insensitive)

200.description: List of all batches for the organization with pagination

post.description: Submit a place for asynchronous enrichment processing.

schema.title: Response Submit Job  Org Slug  Place Enrichment Jobs Post

failed_only.description: When true, only reprocess jobs with 'failed' status. When false, reprocess all jobs in the batch.

incomplete_only.description: When true, only reprocess jobs with 'pending' or 'in_progress' status. When false, reprocess all jobs in the batch (unless failed_only is true).

refresh.description: When true, force fresh enrichment ignoring cached data.

attributes.description: List of specific attributes to enrich (e.g. 'websites', 'phoneNumbers'). If provided, overrides attribute_set.

attribute_set.description: Predefined group of attributes to enrich: 'core', 'all', or 'open_closed'

example.message: Started reprocessing 42 FAILED jobs from batch batch_2024_04_01_123456

get.description: Get metadata for all available enrichment attributes

schema.title: Response Get Enrichment Attributes  Org Slug  Place Enrichment Attributes Get

post.summary: Create a new AI attribute with a default schema

unit_number.title: Unit Number
unit_number.description: An apartment, unit, office, lot, or other secondary unit designator

floor.title: Floor
floor.description: Expressions indicating a floor number e.g. '3rd Floor', 'Ground Floor', etc.

building.title: Building
building.description: Building name e.g. 'Sun Hung Kai Centre', 'The Center', 'Empire State Building'

block.title: Block
block.description: Block number, used in Singapore (SG) e.g., 'Block 329', Malaysia (MY) e.g., 'Blok A', and Indonesia (ID) e.g., 'Blok G5 No. 17'

km.title: Km
km.description: Kilometer marker, commonly used in Malaysia (MY) e.g., 'KM 12, Jalan Cheras' and Indonesia (ID) e.g., 'KM 53, Jl. Tol Jakarta‑Cikampek'. Rarely used in Singapore. Should be parsed as a number (e.g., 'KM 75' should be parsed as '75').

AttributeSet.title: AttributeSet
AttributeSet.description: Defines the set of attributes to enrich for a place.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name for the new AI attribute

CustomAttributeResponse.title: CustomAttributeResponse
CustomAttributeResponse.description: Response model for custom attribute creation

open_closed_status.description: Confidence score for the open/closed status of a place. VERY_HIGH (95% accuracy) indicates extremely reliable open/closed status. HIGH (90% accuracy) indicates very reliable status. MEDIUM (80% accuracy) indicates reasonably reliable status. LOW (70% accuracy) indicates limited online evidence but likely correct status.NONE indicates insufficient evidence to determine status. This happens when a place has no internet presence at all.

school_geofence.description: Confidence score for school geofence data. HIGH indicates OSM-based geofence with reliable school boundary data. MEDIUM indicates parcel-based geofence using property data analysis. NONE indicates no data

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Starting position of the current page

batch_id.title: Batch Id
batch_id.description: Optional unique identifier for the batch. If not provided, a new UUID will be generated. If an existing batch ID is provided, new jobs will be added to that batch.

batch_name.title: Batch Name
batch_name.description: The name of the batch. Only for display purposes. Recommended to use a descriptive human readable name.

jobs.title: Jobs
jobs.description: List of jobs to process. Maximum of 50,000 jobs per batch.

attribute_set.description: Specifies the set of attributes to enrich.

attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: Specifies the list of attributes to enrich. If this is specified it will override the attribute_set. You cannot specify both.

kick_off_jobs_now.title: Kick Off Jobs Now
kick_off_jobs_now.description: Flag to determine if jobs should be kicked off immediately. Only for internal use.

eval.title: Eval
eval.description: When true, enables evaluation mode with 100% LangSmith tracing sampling rate.

place_id.title: Place Id
place_id.description: The customer-identifier for the place and retained as external_customer_id in the database. When not set, will automatically generate a UUID.

attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: List of specific attributes to enrich using enum values (e.g., email_address, phone_number). If both attribute_set and attributes are provided, attributes takes precedence.

attribute_set.description: Specifies the set of attributes to enrich

refresh.title: Refresh
refresh.description: If true, will force a refresh of the place even if it has already been enriched.

eval.title: Eval
eval.description: When true, enables evaluation mode with 100% LangSmith tracing sampling rate.

eval_id.title: Eval Id
eval_id.description: UUID identifier for evaluation session. All places in same batch share the same eval_id when enable_eval=True.

prefilled_data.title: Prefilled Data
prefilled_data.description: Dictionary of prefilled attribute data to insert directly into the database. Keys should match attribute names (e.g., 'phoneNumbers', 'websites'). Data will be validated against the enrichment's response model schema.

failed_only.title: Failed Only
failed_only.description: When true, only reprocess jobs with 'failed' status. When false, reprocess all jobs in the batch.

incomplete_only.title: Incomplete Only
incomplete_only.description: When true, only reprocess jobs with 'pending', 'queued' or 'in_progress' status. When false, reprocess all jobs in the batch (unless failed_only is true).

refresh.title: Refresh
refresh.description: When true, force fresh enrichment ignoring cached data.

attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: List of specific attributes to enrich (e.g. 'websites', 'phoneNumbers'). If provided, overrides attribute_set.

attribute_set.title: Attribute Set
attribute_set.description: Predefined group of attributes to enrich: 'core', 'all', or 'open_closed'

use_mega_agent.title: Use Mega Agent
use_mega_agent.description: When true, use the mega agent for core attribute enrichment. Only works with core attributes.

mega_agent_model.title: Mega Agent Model
mega_agent_model.description: Model to use for mega agent processing. Defaults to gpt-4.1.

enable_eval.title: Enable Eval
enable_eval.description: When true, enable evaluation mode with full LangSmith tracing (sampling rate = 1.0)

eval_id.title: Eval Id
eval_id.description: Optional evaluation session ID for tracking evaluation batches

use_turbo.title: Use Turbo
use_turbo.description: When true, use the turbo queue for faster processing, bypassing normal queue limits

enable_eval.title: Enable Eval
enable_eval.description: When true, enable evaluation mode with full LangSmith tracing (sampling rate = 1.0)

eval_id.title: Eval Id
eval_id.description: Optional evaluation session ID for tracking evaluation batches

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier for tracking the batch

batch_name.title: Batch Name
batch_name.description: User-provided name to identify the batch

status.description: Current processing status of the batch. Initially PENDING, changes to IN_PROGRESS when processing starts

metadata.description: Batch statistics and metadata. Basic stats available to all organizations, detailed stats only for Reprompt.

SubmittedPlaceBatchResponse.title: SubmittedPlaceBatchResponse
SubmittedPlaceBatchResponse.description: Represents the response when submitting a new batch of places for enrichment
